H0.text: A fossil is the most likely state of a leaf that is covered in mud during a landslide after one million years.

H1.text: An animal species is what a leaf covered in mud during a landslide will most likely be after one million years.

H2.text: A new plant species is what a leaf covered in mud during a landslide will most likely be after one million years.

H3.text: A nonrenewable fuel is what a leaf covered in mud during a landslide will most likely be after one million years.

A4.text: For permineralization to occur, the organism must become covered by sediment soon after death, otherwise the remains are destroyed by scavengers or decomposition.

A5.text: Most of these Precambrian fossils are microscopic bacteria or microfossils.
